p.s: In Macbeth's and Lady Macbeth's conversation Lady Macbeth seems to be the leader of the conversation, because she got the biggest part of speaking.
She has many long talking parts (ll. 37-52, 9-19, 23-35).
The beginning of the extract seems like aan examination by Lady Macbeth whyWhy have you left the chamber? (l. 1) Know you not he has?.

ThrougThrough a metaphor Macbeth tries to explain to Lady Macbeth that theirthey are in a good situation and the golden opinions from all sorts of people (l. 6) should be worn now in their newest gloss (l. 7).
Through the methapormetaphor their life right now seems to be very good.
The positive aura and feelings he tries to create explain the choice of words he uses.
Macbeth describes killing Duncan with cast aside (l. 8) what he got.
The first lines already showsshow that Macbeth is not brave as his wife Lady Macbeth.
Macbeth also is afraid but wants to get the power (l. 36).
Lady Macbeth seems in this extract very manipulative.
All she does is to try to convince her husband to kill the king Duncan.
She uses many rhetorical question, especially in her first long paragraph (ll. 9-19).

Was the hope drunk(l. 9) is a personificatationpersonification which is used by Lady Macbeth to say to Macbeth that he lied to hereher and made it seemsseem like he gonna den what they talk about but he dressed himself in the lie (ll. 9f).
She also confronts him in this paragraph with the fact that he is not brave enough to translate his wishes into action (ll. 14f).
Through her tries to convince her husband it seems like Lady Macbeth wants the power more than her husband and that she is more amboutiusambitious and brave.
She does explain her thoughts very well and in a way Macbeth has to overthink his decision what he is going to do because she is questioning his decisions (ll. 14f, 18).
Lady Macbeth also brings the relationship of the two inside of her arguments.
She consider that his action shows how he feels about her and that she does not feel his love that strong, metaphor (ll. 10-12).
Macbeth himself seemseems lost in the extract because only wants to stop Lady Macbeth from continuing with talking (ll. 20-23) and asks if we should fail? (l. 36).

Lady Macbeth also refers to a cat that wants to have a fish without touching water (l. 19) and refearrefers to a baby she has breastfeededbreastfed and killed in the next moment so he could make it (ll. 31-35).
Lastly Macbeth manipulates him through how he would be more than what you were, you would be so much more the man (l. 26f).
After this paragraph Macbeth seems more open because he asks what happens if they won't make it (l. 36).
This case shows that Macbeth wants to be recievedreceived as a strong man by his wife.
They both need to rely on eachother to get what they want.
In this exact extraction the relationship looks like Lady Macbeth wants more than just the love of their.
It looks like her true desire is the power and the relationship between them is strong cause they both want the same.
They act like a team or one human in which Macbeth is the actor and Lady Macbeth is the brain and controller.
After telling Macbeth her plan she convinced him.
In the last paragraph Lady Macbeth uses totwo alliterations and a metaphor receipt of reason (l. 44) wine en wasseil (l. 42) and describes the plan in images.
So it feels like she already can see how the murder is going to happen.
All in all Lady Macbeth seems to be a smart, manaputitivemanipulative womenwoman who uses images to create the effect she wants to bring over.
Macbeth seems to be more passive and afraid and has a conscience which you can see in his little monologue to himself.
Then both tend to be a team which is controlled by Lady Macbeth.
